summary:
McDonald's is an American fast-food chain started in 1940 by the McDonald brothers. It grew from a single restaurant to a global franchise, now with over 40,000 locations in 100+ countries. Ray Kroc played a key role in its expansion.

Known for burgers and fries, McDonald's serves around 69 million customers daily. It's the world's largest fast-food chain and a major employer, with 1.7 million staff. The company also owns most of its restaurant buildings and land, leasing them to franchisees. Despite its success, McDonald's has faced criticism regarding health, employee treatment, and legal issues.
title: McDonald's
